newsitem.title: UK: Rates, inflation worries dampen UK stock market.
newsitem.headline: Rates, inflation worries dampen UK stock market.

text.p: The British stock market ended Wednesday on a lacklustre note as a stronger-than-expected drop in unemployment revived inflation and interest rate worries while a key U.S. monetary policy meeting sidelined investors.

The FTSE 100 share index ended at 3,926.9 points, down 7.4 points and just four points off the day's low. Traders called the market subdued with losers outnumbering gainers three to two in moderate volume of 565 million shares.
"It all looked a bit gloomy after the jobs data hit gilts and futures and we never really recovered from that," one dealer said, noting that Wall Street's dull opening also hit sentiment.
